member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.Web.AddressLabel.AddressDisplayFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the address layout to be either "inform" (vertical) or "inline" (horizontal).
member.remarks: If the address layout is set to "inform", each line contains a single, left-justified element with no separator characters displayed. If the address layout is set to "inline", multiple elements display on a single line, with address elements separated by a single comma and a single space. Individual address elements should not split across multiple lines.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.Web.DateInputBox.Functionality
member.summary: Specifies the functionality exposed by the DateInputBox as "Simple" or "Complex".
member.remarks: Defaults to "Complex" so the DateInputBox's complete functionality is exposed. If this is set to "Simple", only a simple date can be entered such as DateInputBox.Date.DateValue. If the functionality is set to "Simple", the DateInputBox allows other values such as Null Strings to be got and set; the control itself does not, however, respond to these values. In addition, attempting to set the Value.DateType or DateType to any value other than DateType.Exact or DateType.Approximate throws an argument exception.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.Web.MedicationGrid.OnClientClick
member.summary: A JavaScript function which invokes an OnClick event on the client. Occurs when the user clicks the MedicationLine for subscriptions on the client-side.
member.remarks: OnClientClick is actually a behaviour event rather than a behaviour property. It has been specified here as a property so the ExtenderBase writes it to the XML script and ASP.NET AJAX hooks up the event properly. Available on the server-side only.

member.name: T:NhsCui.Toolkit.Web.MedicationLine
member.summary: The MedicationLine controls and enforces complex formatting rules for the display of Virtual Theraputic Moeity (VTM), Virtual Medical Product (VMP) and Actual Medical Product into elements which can be correctly formatted for display in the MedicationLine and MedicationGrid controls. This allows the ISV to construct complex VTM entries, while allowing the actual drug name to have a separate style associated with it.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.Web.MedicationLine.OnClientClick
member.summary: A JavaScript function which invokes an OnClick event on the client. Occurs when the user clicks the MedicationLine for subscriptions on the client-side.
member.remarks: OnClientClick is actually a behaviour event rather than a behaviour property. It has been specified here as a property so the ExtenderBase writes it to the XML script and ASP.NET AJAX hooks up the event properly.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.Web.MedicationLine.OnClientDoubleClick
member.summary: A JavaScript function which invokes an OnClick event on the client. Occurs when the user double-clicks the MedicationLine for subscriptions on the client-side.
member.remarks: OnClientClick is actually a behaviour event rather than a behaviour property. It has been specified here as a property so the ExtenderBase writes it to the XML script and ASP.NET AJAX hooks up the event properly.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.Web.MedicationLine.OnClientRightClick

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.Web.TimeLabel.Display12Hour
member.summary: Specifies whether the hours value should be displayed in 12-hour or 24-hour format.
member.remarks: Defaults to false. If the time is 1:30 in the afternoon, this displays as 01:30 in 12-hour format and 13:30 in 24-hour format. Although the control currently support both 24 hour and 12 hour clock the use of 12 hour clock is NOT supported for safety critical environments, and the ISV has a responsibility to use the controls in a manner appropriate to the clinical context.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.Web.TimeLabel.DisplayAMPM
member.summary: Specifies whether an AM/PM suffix should be included.
member.remarks: Defaults to false. AM refers to times from 00:00 to 11:59:59. PM refers to times from 12:00 to 23:59:59

member.remarks: The text for the ToolTip is drawn from TimeResources.MorningDescription, TimeResources.AfternoonDescription, TimeResources.EveningDescription or TimeResources.NightDescription according to the TimePeriod value.

member.summary: The wrapper for Value.Granularity.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.Web.TimeSpanInputBox.Threshold
member.summary: The wrapper for Value.Threshold.
member.remarks: Specifies the smallest units to be displayed. If IsAge is true, the threshold is set from the time span. If IsAge is false, the threshold is set from the assigned threshold value. The threshold may be seconds, minutes, weeks, hours, days, weeks, months or years.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.Web.TimeSpanInputBox.UnitLength
member.summary: Specifies whether long or short units are displayed.
member.remarks: Defaults to "Short". If long units are specified, the entire unit name is included, such as "month" or "minute". If short units are specified, an abbreviated form of the unit is included, for example "m" for month or "min" for minute. Singular and plural versions of the short and long units are included automatically as appropriate.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.Web.TimeInputBox.AllowApproximate
member.summary: Specifies whether to display a checkbox for the approximate flag.
member.remarks: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.Web.TimeInputBox.DisplaySeconds
member.summary: Specifies whether seconds should be displayed.
member.remarks: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.Web.TimeInputBox.Display12Hour
member.summary: Specifies whether hours should be displayed in 12-hour or 24-hour format.
member.remarks: Defaults to false. If the time is 1:30 in the afternoon, this displays as 01:30 in 12-hour format and 13:30 in 24-hour format. Although the control currently support both 24 hour and 12 hour clock the use of 12 hour clock is NOT supported for safety critical environments, and the ISV has a responsibility to use the controls in a manner appropriate to the clinical context.

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.Web.TimeInputBox.DisplayAMPM
member.summary: Specifies whether an AM/PM suffix should be included.
member.remarks: Defaults to false. AM refers to times from 00:00 to 11:59:59. PM refers to times from 12:00 to 23:59:59

member.name: P:NhsCui.Toolkit.Web.TimeInputBox.Functionality
member.summary: Specifies the functionality exposed by the TimeInputBox as "Simple" or "Complex".
member.remarks: Defaults to "Complex" so the TimeInputBox’s complete functionality is exposed. If this is set to "Simple", only a simple time can be entered such as TimeInputBox.Time.TimeValue. If the functionality is set to "Simple", the TimeInputBox allows other values, such as AllowApproximate and TimePeriod, to be got and set; the control does not, however, respond to these values. In addition, attempting to set the Value.TimeType or TimeType to any value other than TimeType.Exact throws an argument exception.
